text: Rescue by cytokines of apoptotic cell death induced by <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deprivation of human antigen - specific T cell clones .
The control of cell survival and cell death is of central importance in tissues with high cell turnover such as the lymphoid system .

We have examined the effect of cytokines on <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deprivation - induced apoptosis of human antigen - specific T helper clones with different cytokine production profiles .

We found that <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , interferon-alpha ( IFN-alpha ) , and <extra_id_0> IFN-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deprivation apoptosis in Th0 , Th1 , and Th2 clones .

We also found that <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protects T cell clones from <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deprivation apoptosis accompanying active proliferation and enhanced expression of <extra_id_0> P53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Rb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Bcl-xL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins .

text: In contrast , IFN-alpha / beta rescued T cell clones from apoptosis without active proliferation , and expression of apoptosis - associated proteins tested so far was unaffected .

This may be due to the fact that T cells treated with <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contained those located in S + G2 / M phases of the cell cycle , whereas the vast majority of T cells treated with IFN-alpha / beta were located in G0 / G1 phase .

IFN-alpha / beta specifically induced tyrosine phosphorylation and translocation into nucleus of <extra_id_0> signal transducers and activators of transcription (STAT) 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in the T cell clones .

text: In addition , over-expression of <extra_id_0> STAT2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by transfection of the cDNA prevented apoptosis of the T cell clones .

text: Our present study shows that IFN-alpha and -beta mediate anti-apoptotic effect through other pathways than that of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in growth factor deprivation apoptosis .
